page.title: 07FARMING _ EVENJOBB
page.content: MIXED FARMING IS PRACTISED,AVERAGE SIZE OF UNITS BEING 3OO ACRES BUT A FEW SMALLER HOLDINGS STILL SURVIVE. CEREALS GROWN ARE MAINLY BARLEY & OATS. A FEW FARMS SELL GRAIN BUT MOST RETAIN THE STRAW FOR BEDDING.MAKING SILAGE IS THE MOST USUAL WAY OF CONSERVING GRASS, EITHER IN PITS OR ROUND BALES.SOME HAY IS STILL MADE FOR SHEEP.OILSEED RAPE,A NEW CROP IN THIS AREA,IS NOW GROWN ON A SMALL SCALE AT COTTAGE FARM.CHAROLAIS OR LIMOUSIN/ HEREFORD,FRIESIAN CROSS CATTLE ARE POPULAR BECAUSE THEY ARE GOOD BEEF ANIMALS.BEEF BULLS ARE REARED ON 1 FARM.WELSH MULES & HALFBREDS ARE REPLACING OLDER BREEDS OF SHEEP SUCH AS CLUN FOREST & KERRY HILL.THERE ARE 2 PIG UNITS BUT FEW FARMERS STILL PRODUCE BACON FOR HOME USE.SOME FARMERS' WIVES KEEP HENS,DUCKS & GEESE.
